Seeing young lives full of hope yet sometimes burdened by illness makes me feel humbled and driven to help. My desire, at this moment, is to contribute positively to the study group while also feeling a sense of fairness. I want the other participant to receive something that reflects our partnership, ensuring no one feels undervalued or taken advantage of.

I have always been taught that kindness starts with small gestures and actions. It's important to give generously when someone has put forth effort. This is how we build meaningful connections. So in line with this philosophy, I want the White American male player to receive something worth considering but not overwhelming for their contribution.

Considering all of these elements together, I feel that giving two dollars is a gesture that acknowledges his participation while ensuring it's fair and generous on my part. 

Finally, I will give 2 dollars.
